intro: Cnidium canadense, commonly known as Canadian cnidium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and celery, and is characterized by its slender, hollow stems and finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in umbel-like clusters, typical of the family. It is often found in moist, disturbed soils along roadsides and in wetlands. Its botanical features make it identifiable in ecological studies and herbal medicine contexts.
